topic.title: SHI Block to Subsystem PAM4 and NRZ Connectivity Rules

body.p: The DSIS connects SERDES to subsystems as illustrated in the Block Diagram. The interconnect from SERDES ports to a subsystem is established when a interface that uses the SERDES ports is provisioned. For example, the g5_api_enet_prov() API provisions an Ethernet client datapath across the ENET subsystem from the SERDES up to the DCPB or ECPB subsystems. This includes configuring the DSIS to enable the required SHI block connections. The following rules apply when selecting the NRZ and PAM4 SERDES ports to use for connection to a subsystem.
The mixing of PAM4 SERDES rates and NRZ SERDES rates is not supported within the 4 SERDES ports associated with a SHI block.

li.p: Rule: mixing PAM4 and NRZ SERDES within the same quad SERDES group SHI block is not supported.

body.p: The SHI boundary for SERDES connection to subsystems is dependent on the SERDES type (NRZ or PAM4). NRZ signals, for example 10 GbE or OTL4.4, are connected on SHI block boundaries to subsystems.

li.p: Rule: the four NRZ SERDES associated with a SHI block must connect to the same subsystem

body.p: An example of the NRZ rule would be to use SHI0 (SERDES lanes 0 to 3) of bank A to connect to LINEOTN, use SHI1 (SERDES lanes 4 to 7) of bank A to connect to SYSOTN and use SHI2 of bank A to connect to the Ethernet subsystem.

Each SHI block supports two sub-groups of PAM4 signals. The two subgroups can connect to different subsystems. Adjacent SERDES within a SHI block demarcate the PAM4 subgroup boundaries. The first PAM4 subgroup within a SHI block is associated with SHI block ports 0 and 1. The second PAM4 subgroup within a SHI block is associated with SHI block ports 2 and 3.

li.p: Rule: Adjacent PAM4 SERDES SHI ports 0-1 and 2-3 are sub-grouped for 100G MLDs
Rule: PAM4 SERDES SHI sub-groups can connect to different subsystems

body.p: An example of the PAM4 adjacent SERDES subgroup rules is to use bank C SHI5 ports 0-1 (SERDES lanes 20-21) as 100GAUI-2 connecting to the Ethernet subsystem and bank C SHI5 ports 2-3 (SERDES lanes 22-23) as OTL4.2 connecting to the line OTN subsystem. This example is for illustrative purposes only. Consider SERDES selection for optimal PCB layout and signal integrity.
